intro: Lastrea barclayi, commonly known as the Barclay's lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. The flowers are small and often yellow or orange, adding a vibrant touch to its drought-tolerant appearance.
